test_cases.description: Verify that create_task successfully creates a task when provided with valid task data.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_with_valid_data

test_setup.given: A valid task_data object containing required fields (e.g., title, description, user_id). The repository and logger are functioning.
test_setup.then: The function logs the creation attempt and repository.add_task is called with task_data. The result from repository.add_task is returned.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with the valid task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles missing title in task_data appropriately.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_missing_title

test_setup.given: A task_data object missing the required 'title' field.
test_setup.then: The function should handle the missing title, possibly by raising a validation error or returning an error response.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with this invalid task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles empty task_data input.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_empty_task_data

test_setup.given: An empty task_data object is provided.
test_setup.then: The function should handle the missing data, raising an error or returning a validation error.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with the empty task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles null task_data input.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_null_task_data

test_setup.given: A null value is passed as task_data.
test_setup.then: The function should raise a TypeError or a custom exception indicating invalid input.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with null task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task ignores or handles extra fields in task_data.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_with_extra_fields

test_setup.given: A task_data object with all required fields and additional unexpected fields.
test_setup.then: The function should either ignore the extra fields or handle them gracefully, and create the task using the supported fields.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with this task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles a repository failure (e.g., database error) gracefully.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_repository_failure

test_setup.given: A valid task_data object and a repository.add_task implementation that raises an exception.
test_setup.then: The function should log the error and propagate or handle the exception appropriately.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with the valid task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task logs the creation attempt with the correct user information.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_logs_creation_attempt

test_setup.given: A valid task_data object including a user_id and a mock logger.
test_setup.then: The logger should record a message indicating a creation attempt for the specified user.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task works when only the minimal required fields are provided.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_with_minimal_required_fields

test_setup.given: A task_data object with only the minimal required fields (e.g., 'title', 'user_id').
test_setup.then: The function should successfully create the task and return the result.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with this task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles a very long title field appropriately.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_with_long_title

test_setup.given: A task_data object with a 'title' field of maximum supported length.
test_setup.then: The function should handle the long title according to system limits (success or error if too long).

test_cases.description: Verify that create_task handles fields with special characters.
test_cases.name: test_create_task_with_special_characters

test_setup.given: A task_data object where 'title' and 'description' include special and non-ASCII characters.
test_setup.then: The function should create the task and store the special characters correctly.

test_cases.description: Verify that a task is successfully created when valid task data is provided.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_valid_data

test_setup.given: task_data contains valid fields: title, description, due_date, and user_id.
test_setup.then: A Task object is returned with the expected attributes, and the operation is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when the title field is missing.
test_cases.name: create_task_missing_title

test_setup.given: task_data is missing the 'title' field.
test_setup.then: An error is raised indicating the missing required field, and no task is created.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when the title field is empty.
test_cases.name: create_task_empty_title

test_setup.given: task_data contains an empty string as 'title'.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or task is not created due to invalid title.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when the due_date is in an invalid format.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_invalid_due_date_format

test_setup.given: task_data contains a due_date in an invalid format (e.g., '31-12-2024').
test_setup.then: An error is raised indicating the invalid date format, and no task is created.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when user_id is missing from the task_data.
test_cases.name: create_task_missing_user_id

test_setup.given: task_data is missing the 'user_id' field.
test_setup.then: An error is raised indicating missing user information, and no task is created.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation works when the title is at the maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: create_task_boundary_title_length

test_setup.given: task_data contains a title with the maximum allowed length (e.g., 255 characters).
test_setup.then: A Task object is created successfully, and the operation is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation works with special characters in the title.
test_cases.name: create_task_special_characters_title

test_setup.given: task_data contains a title with special characters (e.g., '@#$%&*').
test_setup.then: A Task object is created successfully, and the operation is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails gracefully when the repository throws an exception.
test_cases.name: create_task_repository_failure

test_setup.given: TaskRepository.add_task is mocked to throw an exception.
test_setup.then: The exception is propagated or handled gracefully, and an error is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when task_data is null.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_null_task_data

test_setup.given: task_data is null.
test_setup.then: An error is raised indicating invalid input, and no task is created.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation works with only mandatory fields provided.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_minimal_fields

test_setup.given: task_data contains only mandatory fields (e.g., title and user_id).
test_setup.then: A Task object is created successfully, and the operation is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation fails when trying to create a duplicate task (same title and user_id).
test_cases.name: create_task_with_duplicate_task

test_setup.given: A task with the same title and user_id already exists in the repository.
test_setup.then: An error is raised indicating the duplication, and no task is created.

test_cases.description: Verify that task creation works when the description is at its maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_long_description

test_setup.given: task_data contains a description with the maximum allowed length (e.g., 1024 characters).
test_setup.then: A Task object is created successfully, and the operation is logged.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task correctly creates and persists a task when given minimal valid data.
test_cases.name: add_task_with_minimal_valid_data

test_setup.given: task_data contains only required fields, e.g., {'title': 'Test Task'}; ID counter is at initial value (e.g., 1); task list is empty.
test_setup.then: Returned Task has assigned ID 1, data matches input, task is appended to task list, counter is incremented, tasks are saved to file, and creation is logged.
test_setup.when: Function add_task is called with this task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles and persists tasks with all possible fields.
test_cases.name: add_task_with_all_fields

test_setup.given: task_data contains all possible fields (e.g., 'title', 'description', 'due_date', 'priority').
test_setup.then: Returned Task includes all specified fields, correct new ID, and data is saved to file and list.
test_setup.when: Function add_task is called with this task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that each added task receives a unique, incremented ID.
test_cases.name: add_task_id_increments_with_multiple_tasks

test_setup.given: task list contains N tasks, ID counter is at N+1.
test_setup.then: First returned Task has ID N+1, second has ID N+2; both tasks are persisted.
test_setup.when: add_task is called twice with valid task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles an empty string for a required field like 'title'.
test_cases.name: add_task_with_empty_title

test_setup.given: task_data with 'title' set to an empty string.
test_setup.then: Function raises a validation error or returns an error response (depending on implementation).

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task rejects input missing required fields (e.g., missing 'title').
test_cases.name: add_task_missing_required_title

test_setup.given: task_data is missing the required 'title' field.
test_setup.then: Function raises an exception or returns an error response indicating missing field.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles invalid date format in 'due_date' field.
test_cases.name: add_task_invalid_due_date_format

test_setup.given: task_data includes a 'due_date' with invalid format (e.g., '2024-99-99').
test_setup.then: Function raises a validation error or returns an error response.

test_cases.description: Verify function behavior when the file system is not writable (e.g., save to file fails).
test_cases.name: add_task_file_save_failure

test_setup.given: task_data is valid; file system is set to read-only or file saving throws an IOError.
test_setup.then: Function handles the error gracefully, does not increment ID or append to list, and returns or logs an error.

test_cases.description: Test behavior when 'title' field is extremely large (e.g., 10,000 characters).
test_cases.name: add_task_with_very_large_title

test_setup.given: task_data with 'title' as a string of length 10,000 characters.
test_setup.then: Task is persisted if within limits, or function raises a validation/storage error if not supported.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task correctly handles special characters in the 'title' field.
test_cases.name: add_task_with_special_characters_in_title

test_setup.given: task_data with 'title' containing special characters (e.g., emojis, symbols).
test_setup.then: Task is persisted and special characters are properly stored and returned.

test_cases.description: Verify that add_task allows tasks with duplicate titles if uniqueness is not required.
test_cases.name: add_task_with_duplicate_title

test_setup.given: task list contains a task with title 'Task A'; new task_data also has 'title': 'Task A'.
test_setup.then: New task is added with a unique ID, and both tasks with the same title exist.

test_cases.description: Test behavior when the task ID counter is at its maximum allowed value (e.g., maximum integer).
test_cases.name: add_task_when_id_counter_at_max_value

test_setup.given: ID counter is set to system maximum value (e.g., 2^31-1 for 32-bit int).
test_setup.then: Function raises an overflow error, handles gracefully, or returns an error as appropriate.
